With information of this type we are able to obtain upper and lower bounds for the maximum modulus of an entire GBSHE function,  at least for certain ranges of x and y.  For instance we have the following result :
Theorem 6.  2.  Let u ( x ^ y ) be an entire GBSHE function with series representation ( 2.  4 ) ; then for R sufficiently large and any e > 0 there exists аЯ ^ 0 such that the maximum modulus ^ M { R )^ of u { x ^ y ) for x and у such that y ^ < ^ x ^ is bounded above by M ( R ) < e ^^^\ Moreover ^ if the order of the associate ^ f ^ of и is X > i ^ then the maximum modulus,  for all X and y,  is bounded below by < M { R ).
The first assertion follows at once from Lemma 5.  1 and the fact that
